alfredsnippet.snippet:
(cont'd)

"... The important thing is to be able to make predictions about the images on the astronomer's photographic plates, frequencies of spectral lines, and so on, and it simply doesn't matter whether we ascribe these predictions to the physical effect of a gravitational field on the motion of planets and photons or to a curvature of space and time."

- Steven Weinberg
alfredsnippet.name: Phys.org Post - The Geometric Interpretation of the Theory of Gravitation Has Dwindled to a Mere Analogy - Part 2
